translation.en: The following interview with the late Ruth Bader Ginsburg
translation.ko: "넷플릭스 다큐멘터리 시리즈" 고 루스 베이더 긴즈버그와의 다음 인터뷰는

translation.en: took place at the US Supreme Court on August 2nd, 2019.
It had originally been scheduled a few weeks later.
translation.ko: 원래는 그보다 몇 주 후로 예정돼 있었으나

translation.en: It was brought forward at her request.
It was subsequently revealed
that a cancerous tumor had been discovered on her pancreas,
translation.ko: 췌장에서 암으로 보이는 종양이 발견된 긴즈버그는

translation.en: and three days after the interview, she began radiation therapy.
translation.ko: 인터뷰가 끝나고 3일 후 방사선 치료를 시작했습니다

translation.en: This is one of her last interviews.
translation.ko: 이건 그녀의 마지막 인터뷰 중 하나입니다

translation.en: [Ginsburg] I had two years out of university when I was married
translation.ko: 대학교를 2년 다닌 후에 남편이 입대하는 바람에 결혼하게 됐어요

translation.en: because my husband was called into service.
And during those two years, I became pregnant.
And I worried, would I be able to manage
a young child and Harvard Law School?
So my husband's father said to me,
"Ruth, if you don't want to go to law school,
no one will think the less of you."
"You have a very good reason not to enroll."
translation.ko: '등록 안 해도 될 좋은 이유가 있어'

translation.en: "But if you really want to be a lawyer,
you will stop feeling sorry for yourself."
"You will pick yourself up, and you will find a way."
And that advice, at every turn in my life,
I thought, "Do I really want this?"
And if the answer's "Yes," you find a way.
This was inspired by Nelson Mandela.
translation.ko: 이 프로는 넬슨 만델라의 다음 말에 영감받았습니다

translation.en: Who once said, "What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived…
translation.ko: '삶에서 중요한 건 우리가 살았다는 단순한 사실이 아니다'

translation.en: [Meghan] …it is what difference we have made to the lives of others
that will determine the significance of the life we lead."
[Harry] His life left a lasting mark on the world.
translation.ko: 그의 삶은 세상에 영원한 흔적을 남겼습니다

translation.en: A legacy that has helped inspire so many others to stand up.
translation.ko: 많은 이들한테 당당히 일어서라고 영감을 준 유산이죠

translation.en: To fight for change and to become leaders.
[Harry] So this is in memory of Madiba.
translation.ko: "흑인의 목숨은 소중합니다" 이것은 마디바를 기리기 위한 것입니다

translation.en: [Meghan] It was made to remind us of the difference one person can make.
translation.ko: 한 사람이 만들 수 있는 차이를 일깨워 주려고 만든 것이죠

translation.en: [Harry] It's about people who have made brave choices.
Leaders who have walked alongside him and followed in his footsteps.
translation.ko: 그와 함께 걸었고 그의 길을 따르는 리더들의 이야기고요

translation.en: [Meghan] Caring for others. Working for a better and more equal world.
translation.ko: 남을 아끼고 더 낫고 평등한 세상을 위해 일한 이들의 이야기죠

translation.en: [Harry] And giving inspiration to the rest of us
to live to lead.
♪ You can't break me down You can't take me down ♪
-[man 1] Are we all good to go? -[man 2] Yep.
-[woman] Hey, are we rolling? -[man 1] We're rolling.
-[woman] Okay. Justice Ginsburg-- -Yes?
[woman] Take one.
[woman] I can't imagine anyone else on Earth
translation.ko: 같은 방에 있어 가장 자랑스러운 사람으로

translation.en: who I would be more proud to be in the room with than Ms. Ginsburg.
translation.ko: 긴즈버그 씨 외에 다른 분은 상상이 가질 않습니다

translation.en: [Stephen Colbert] They call her the Notorious R.B.G.
She's a feminist icon, and a favorite among the young people.
[woman] She is the standard of courage
and intellect and kindness and heart.
[man] Ruth used to ask,
"What is the difference between a bookkeeper in Brooklyn
and a Supreme Court justice?"
Her answer?
"One generation."
It has been said that Ruth wanted to be an opera virtuoso
translation.ko: 루스에 대해 이렇게들 말하죠 오페라 거장이 되고 싶었는데

translation.en: but became a rock star instead.
[Bill Clinton] Virtually every significant case brought before the Supreme Court
in the decade of the '70s on behalf of women,
bore her mark.
[man] Later, she became a star on the bench,
where she sat for 27 years.
She's an amazing, brave woman. And strong.
[Ginsburg] People ask me sometimes,
"When will there be enough women on the court?"
And my answer is,
"When there are nine."
[interviewer] So much has been written and said about you,
but I wonder if we could start with you telling me a little bit about your life.
translation.ko: 직접 자신의 삶에 대해 얘기해 주시면 좋겠어요

translation.en: My current life, and for the past 26 years,
I have been a member of the Supreme Court of the United States.
Before that, I was a lawyer and a law teacher.
My entering law school class had some 500 students.
translation.ko: "소녀 시절" 제가 로스쿨에 입학할 때 학생이 500명쯤 됐는데

translation.en: Nine of them were women.
Parents of girls in those days
translation.ko: 당시 딸을 둔 부모님들이 생각할 때

translation.en: thought the most important degree for their daughter
was not the Bachelor of Arts or Sciences.
It was the MRS degree.
But my mother was not that way.
One of the things she urged strongly
was that it's fine if you meet Prince Charming,
translation.ko: 백마 탄 왕자님을 만나도 괜찮기는 하지만

translation.en: but always be able to fend for yourself.
Be independent.
Two things were important to my mother.
One was that I be independent,
and the other, she called it "being a lady."
And by that, she didn't mean wearing white gloves,
translation.ko: 그 의미는 하얀 장갑을 끼란 게 아니었어요

translation.en: she meant that a lady doesn't give way
translation.ko: 숙녀의 정의는 아무 쓸모 없이 에너지만 낭비하는 감정에

translation.en: to emotions that sap energy and do no good.
translation.ko: 아무 쓸모 없이 에너지만 낭비하는 감정에 굴복하지 않는 여자였어요

translation.en: So anger, jealousy, remorse.
Those were emotions that don't move you forward.
translation.ko: 그런 감정이 있으면 앞으로 나아가지 못해요

translation.en: They trap you.
Don't snap back in anger.
Take a few deep breaths,
and respond in a way that you may be persuasive.
It was a great sadness in my young life
that she died the day before I graduated from high school.
translation.ko: 제 고등학교 졸업 하루 전에 어머니가 돌아가신 일이었죠

translation.en: She battled cancer for four years,
and then finally succumbed.
I decided to become a lawyer when I was a college student.
translation.ko: 저는 대학생 때 "목적을 찾아서" 변호사가 되기로 했어요

translation.en: It was a bad time for the United States. There was a huge Red Scare.
translation.ko: 미국에 안 좋은 시기였고 적색 공포가 만연했어요

translation.en: [anchor] This is no field day for Moscow or its sympathizers.
translation.ko: 오늘은 모스크바나 그 동조자에게 악몽 같은 날입니다 "공산주의자는 모스크바의 간첩"

translation.en: [Senator McCarthy] The only answer
translation.ko: 공산주의 세계의 승리 전략에 대한 유일한 대답은

translation.en: to a strategy of victory for the communist world
translation.ko: 공산주의 세계의 승리 전략에 대한 유일한 대답은 "부패한 지식인이 공산주의에 합류하면 두뇌만 잃고 만다"

translation.en: is a strategy of victory for the free world.
[Ginsburg] And there was a senator from Wisconsin, Joe McCarthy,
translation.ko: 위스콘신주의 상원 의원 조 매카시란 사람은

translation.en: who saw a communist in every corner.
Apparently, every time anybody says anything
against anybody working for Senator McCarthy…
translation.ko: 일하는 사람들에 대해 누가 안 좋게 말하면…

translation.en: -[man] Just answer the quest-- -…he's accusing them of communism.
[man] Just answer the question.
People were hauled before the House Un-American Activities Committee.
translation.ko: 사람들이 하원 비미 활동 위원회로 끌려갔어요

translation.en: And my professor of constitutional law
impressed upon me that lawyers were standing up for these people
translation.ko: 변호사들이 이 사람들을 위해 발 벗고 일어나서

translation.en: and reminding our Congress that we have a First Amendment
translation.ko: 의회에 상기시켜 준다고 했어요 우린 수정 헌법 제1조가 있어서

translation.en: that protects our right to think, speak, and write as we believe,
translation.ko: 믿는 대로 생각하고 말하고 쓸 우리 권리를 보호해 준다고요

translation.en: and not as some Big Brother government tells us.
translation.ko: 빅 브라더 정부가 시키는 대로 믿는 게 아니라요

translation.en: [Ginsburg] That there is the right to freedom of thought and expression.
translation.ko: 사상과 표현의 자유를 보장받을 권리가 있다고요

translation.en: I said that I was exercising my rights
guaranteed to me under the Fifth Amendment of the Constitution.
So that gave me the idea that being a lawyer was a pretty nifty thing to do.
translation.ko: 그래서 변호사가 되는 게 좋은 일이라는 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: I thought I could earn a living, and then I could do something
to make things a little better in my society.
[Ginsburg] I didn't appreciate fully the barriers to going and getting a job in the law.
translation.ko: 법조계에 취직하는 데 장벽이 있다는 건 그땐 저도 몰랐어요

translation.en: I did very well in law school,
but there wasn't a single firm in the city of New York
that would offer me a job.
I don't know how many times I heard from law firms,
translation.ko: 로펌에서 이런 말을 수도 없이 들었어요

translation.en: "We had a lady lawyer, and she was dreadful."
I had three strikes against me.
One is I am Jewish, and there was considerable antisemitism.
The second, I was a woman, and those barriers were just beginning to fall.
translation.ko: 둘째로 전 여자였는데 그 장벽이 막 무너지기 시작했던 때였죠

translation.en: The third one was a strikeout.
I was a mother.
My daughter was four years old when I graduated from law school.
translation.ko: 제가 로스쿨을 졸업했을 때 제 딸은 4살이었어요

translation.en: So the rare firms that would take a chance on a woman
translation.ko: 여성을 고용하려는 몇 안 되는 로펌도

translation.en: would not risk hiring a mother.
When the women's movement came alive in the late 1960s,
I knew that's what I-- I wanted.
translation.ko: 그게 제가 원하는 거란 걸 알았어요

translation.en: There were things that I had observed growing up.
Before I became a lawyer,
there was a time when women were not accepted as members of the bar.
translation.ko: 여자는 변호사 협회에서 받아주지도 않던 때가 있었죠

translation.en: There were no women judges. Very few women engineers.
translation.ko: 여자 판사도 없었고 여자 엔지니어는 극소수였고요

translation.en: No women police officers. No women firefighters.
translation.ko: 여자 경찰도 없었고 여자 소방관도 없었어요

translation.en: [news anchor] This is Mary McDonald.
Age? Well, old enough to be the mother of those three.
translation.ko: 나이요? 저 아이들 셋의 엄마가 될 정도는 먹었습니다

translation.en: Profession? That's part of it right there.
Together, with a good deal of housework and lots of mileage in the family car.
translation.ko: 집안일도 많이 하고 가족을 위해 운전사 노릇도 하죠

translation.en: And I thought, "Well, that's just part of the territory."
"You have to put up with it."
But in the late '60s, women began to think,
"No, we don't have to put up with it. We should be able to do
translation.ko: '아니, 우리는 참을 필요 없어 우리도 우리 재능대로'

translation.en: whatever we have the talent to do,
and no one should stop us simply because we're women."
translation.ko: '아무도 우리가 여자이기 때문에 못 한다고 할 수 없어'

translation.en: I was teaching law at Rutgers University,
and my students wanted to have a course on women and the law.
translation.ko: 제 학생들이 여성과 법에 대한 과목을 배우고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: And in the space of a month,
I read every federal decision about women's rights or the lack thereof.
translation.ko: 여성의 권리와 그 부재에 관한 연방 판결을 전부 읽었어요 "여성들이여, 단결하라"

translation.en: Women were making claims that they hadn't before.
translation.ko: "고용주들은 여자들한테 저임금 노동만을 맡긴다" 여자들은 전에 안 하던 주장을 하기 시작했어요

translation.en: So I was a volunteer lawyer for the American Civil Liberties Union,
translation.ko: 전 미국 시민 자유 연맹에서 변호사로 자원봉사 하면서

translation.en: devoting the entire decade of the '70s to see what I could contribute.
translation.ko: "정도껏 해! 이 무지한 남성들아!" 1970년대의 10년을 전부 바쳐 그 단체 일을 도왔어요

translation.en: So in that decade of the '70s,
I appeared before many courts. This court included.
translation.ko: 여러 법정에서 변론했어요 이 법정도 포함해서요

translation.en: When I first got into the business of gender equality,
translation.ko: 제가 처음 성평등에 관련된 일을 맡았을 때는

translation.en: it was a world in which most men thought,
"There really is no such thing as discrimination against women."
translation.ko: "여성 해방" '여성에 대한 차별이란 건 실제로는 존재하지 않는다'

translation.en: All the barriers were regarded as protections.
[Ginsburg on old recording] They exclude women from an occupation
translation.ko: 남성한테 더 적합하다고 여겨지는 직업에서 여성을 제외했습니다

translation.en: thought more appropriate to men.
translation.ko: 남성한테 더 적합하다고 여겨지는 직업에서 여성을 제외했습니다 "프론티에로 대 리처드슨 1973년"

translation.en: The sex criterion stigmatizes
when it is used to limit hours of work for women only.
translation.ko: 제한하는 데만 쓰인다면 그 의미는 퇴색합니다

translation.en: Hours regulations, today, "protect" women
translation.ko: 현재의 근무 시간 규정은 여성이 경쟁을 통해

translation.en: from competing for extra remuneration, higher-paying jobs, promotions.
translation.ko: 높은 보수나 고임금 일자리를 얻고 승진하는 것을 막고 있습니다

translation.en: People knew that race discrimination was odious.
translation.ko: 사람들은 인종 차별이 끔찍하다는 걸 알았고

translation.en: Discrimination based on religion was a bad thing.
translation.ko: 종교에 근거한 차별도 나쁘다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: But they didn't think that about the barriers that women face.
translation.ko: 하지만 여성이 직면하는 장벽은 그렇게 생각하지 않았어요

translation.en: There's a line of contention that…
more protections are necessary for women.
translation.ko: 여성한테 더 많은 보호가 필요하다는 부분입니다

translation.en: From bans on pornography to child-rearing benefits for mothers
translation.ko: 포르노 금지부터 어머니는 자녀 양육 수당을 받지만

translation.en: but not for fathers, not equally for fathers.
translation.ko: 아버지는 못 받는 것은 아버지한테 불평등한 겁니다

translation.en: Uh, the greater protection that women need from
translation.ko: 여성한테 더 큰 보호가 필요한 부분은

translation.en: child sexual molestation,
where they are more frequently the victims,
and I'd be interested in your thinking as to the use of the legislative branch
translation.ko: 그래서 1980년대에 여성을 대변한 다른 사람들의 주장과 함께

translation.en: as some of the other women's advocates have articulated the views in the 1980s.
translation.ko: 입법부의 일원으로서의 귀하의 생각이 듣고 싶습니다

translation.en: I think it's grand to use the legislative branch.
What you discuss, Senator Specter, I think reflects a large generational difference.
translation.ko: 스펙터 의원님 말씀은 큰 세대 간의 차이를 반영하는데요

translation.en: In the days of the protective laws,
the legislative branch was used extensively.
And the legislative branch said that we'll restrict the hours
translation.ko: 그리고 입법부에서는 여성의 근무 시간만 제한했지

translation.en: for women but not for men.
We will restrict night work for women but not for men.
translation.ko: 여성의 야간 근무는 제한하지만 남성은 안 하고

translation.en: We will restrict the jobs that women can take but not men.
translation.ko: 여성이 가질 수 있는 일자리는 제한하지만 남성은 안 하죠

translation.en: Because we know better, we can protect them.
translation.ko: 입법부가 더 똑똑하고 여성을 '보호'할 수 있다고요

translation.en: They need to be protected from unhealthy and unsafe conditions.
translation.ko: 여성은 건강에 해가 되는 위험한 환경으로부터 '보호'받아야 한다고 하죠

translation.en: Especially jobs that pay double time, um, and the like.
translation.ko: 특히 돈을 두 배로 주는 일 같은 직업으로부터요

translation.en: The legislature works all over the place protecting women.
translation.ko: 의회는 모든 분야에서 여성을 '보호'하는 일을 하고 있습니다

translation.en: They thought they operated benignly in the women's favor.
And another one, women didn't serve on juries
because they were considered the center of home and family life.
What that says to a woman is, "You're not really a full citizen."
Citizens have obligations, as well as rights.
My generation had the sense that
that protection was protecting men's jobs against…
from women's competition.
[Ginsburg in interview] I knew what I was doing was important
and that I had to make people understand.
Supreme Court Justice Brennan put it very well.
translation.ko: 브레넌 대법관이 그걸 아주 잘 표현했어요

translation.en: The woman was not on a pedestal.
She was, in fact, in a cage.
And on the other side, there were several cases in which I represented men.
translation.ko: 또 한편으로는 제가 남성을 대변한 사건도 꽤 있어요

translation.en: One of my favorite clients, his wife died in childbirth,
translation.ko: 제가 좋아하는 고객 한 분은 아내가 출산 중 사망해

translation.en: and he was left the sole surviving parent.
translation.ko: 한 부모 양육자가 됐어요 "아내를 잃고 재정 혜택을 받기 위해 싸우는 아버지"

translation.en: There were childcare benefits if a male worker dies,
translation.ko: 남성 근로자가 죽으면 아동 양육비를 받지만

translation.en: but if a female worker died,
there were no childcare benefits for the widower.
translation.ko: 혼자 남은 남편에겐 양육비가 지급되지 않아요

translation.en: [Ginsburg on old recording] The underlying assumption was,
"Wives are typically dependent, husbands are not."
The impact is to encourage the traditional division of labor between man and woman.
translation.ko: "와인버거 대 위젠필드 1975년" 남성과 여성 간 노동의 전형적인 분리를 부추기는 거죠

translation.en: [Ginsburg in interview] We were trying to change that way of thinking.
So that men, if they were parents,
would have the same benefits as women.
And women who wanted to be whatever,
translation.ko: 그리고 여성도 되고 싶은 게 있으면

translation.en: a doctor or a lawyer, police officer,
that would be fine.
Virtually every significant case brought before the Supreme Court
translation.ko: 1970년대 10년 동안 여성과 관련하여 대법원에 상정된 모든 중요한 사건은

translation.en: in the decade of the '70s on behalf of women,
bore her mark.
Wanting what seems now to be such a terribly simple principle,
translation.ko: 지금은 아주 단순해 보이는 원칙을 바라면서요

translation.en: equal treatment for women and men before the law.
translation.ko: 바로 법 앞에서 여성과 남성이 동등하게 대우받는 것이죠

translation.en: [interviewer] A principle that was always embraced by your husband, Marty.
translation.ko: 판사님 부군이신 마티는 늘 그 원칙을 지키셨어요

translation.en: In every way.
I have had the great, good fortune to share life with a partner
translation.ko: 정말 운이 좋게도 저와 인생을 나누는 제 동반자는

translation.en: truly extraordinary for his generation.
translation.ko: 그 세대 사람이라고 믿기지 않을 만큼 정말 특별합니다

translation.en: A man who believed at age 18, when we met,
and who believes today…
that a woman's work…
whether at home or on the job,
is as important as a man's.
I became a lawyer
in days when women were not wanted by most members of the legal profession.
translation.ko: 여성을 원치 않던 시절에 변호사가 됐습니다

translation.en: I became a lawyer because Marty, and his parents,
translation.ko: 제가 변호사가 된 건 남편과 제 시부모님이

translation.en: supported that choice unreservedly.
[Ginsburg in interview] He was always my biggest booster,
translation.ko: 남편은 항상 가장 열렬하게 절 지지했고

translation.en: and he was tireless in his effort to see
that I would be the nominee.
He also had a particular skill. He was a great cook.
translation.ko: 남편에겐 특별한 기술이 있었는데 훌륭한 요리사였어요

translation.en: Our arrangement was, when my children were young,
translation.ko: 아이들이 어렸을 때 둘이 합의한 바는

translation.en: I was the everyday cook, he was the weekend and company cook.
translation.ko: 주중엔 제가 요리하고 주말과 손님이 왔을 땐 남편이 요리했어요

translation.en: My daughter, in her teens,
noticed the enormous difference between Daddy's cooking and Mommy's.
translation.ko: 엄마와 아빠의 요리가 큰 차이가 있다는 걸 눈치채고

translation.en: And decided Daddy shouldn't be just the weekend cook,
he should be the everyday cook.
So for all the years that I've lived in Washington, DC,
translation.ko: 그래서 워싱턴 D.C.에 사는 동안에는 내내

translation.en: I've not cooked a meal.
There is one in this audience whose presence I want specially to acknowledge.
translation.ko: 이 청중 가운데 제가 특별히 언급하고 싶은 사람이 있습니다

translation.en: She is my wonderful mother-in-law, Evelyn Ginsburg.
translation.ko: 바로 훌륭한 제 시어머니이신 에벌린 긴즈버그 여사입니다

translation.en: My mother-in-law, on my wedding day, gave me the best advice ever.
translation.ko: 제 결혼식 날 시어머니께서 최고의 조언을 해 주셨어요

translation.en: She said, "Dear, I would like to tell you the secret of a happy marriage."
"Well, I'd be glad to have it. What is it?"
She said, "Sometimes, it helps to be a little… deaf."
That is, if an unkind word is spoken, you tune out.
translation.ko: 듣기 싫은 말이 들리면 못 들은 척하란 거죠

translation.en: And I have followed that advice assiduously.
Not only in dealing with my dear spouse but with my colleagues.
translation.ko: 사랑하는 배우자뿐만 아니라 동료들을 대할 때도요

translation.en: [interviewer] What do you think the world needs more of at this moment?
translation.ko: 지금 이 순간 세상에 더 필요한 게 뭐라고 생각하세요?

translation.en: Um. If I could pick one word, it would be "listening."
I think,
today, people tend to talk only to like-minded people.
translation.ko: 요즘 사람들은 생각이 맞는 사람과만 대화하는 것 같아요

translation.en: I think the social media intensifies that.
translation.ko: SNS 때문에 그게 더 심해진 것 같고요

translation.en: One of the things that has made America great
translation.ko: 미국을 위대하게 만든 이유 중 하나는

translation.en: is that we have such a diverse population.
So many different backgrounds, racial and national origins.
translation.ko: 배경, 인종, 출신 국가가 너무나 다양하거든요

translation.en: And the ability to not just tolerate
but even applaud our differences and yet come together.
translation.ko: 용인하는 것에 그치지 않고 서로 축복하며 하나가 되는 거죠

translation.en: When once asked, how we could be friends given our disagreement on lots of things,
translation.ko: "앤터닌 스캘리아 대법관 추도식 추도사, 2016년" 의견이 다른데 어떻게 친구가 될 수 있느냐는 질문을 받았을 때

translation.en: Justice Scalia answered, "I attack ideas. I don't attack people."
translation.ko: 스캘리아 대법관은 대답했죠 '전 사람이 아닌 생각을 공격해요'

translation.en: "Some very good people have some very bad ideas."
translation.ko: '아주 선량한 사람들도 아주 나쁜 생각을 하기도 하죠'

translation.en: The motto of the United States is, "E pluribus unum."
"Of many, one."
And that's, with all our diversity… Yet, we are one nation,
translation.ko: 그 말은 우리는 다양하지만 수호할 수 있는 민주주의로

translation.en: with a democracy I hope we can keep.
I would say that we are not experiencing the best of times.
translation.ko: 지금 우리가 겪는 시기가 좋다고는 할 수 없어요

translation.en: Our legislature, which is the first branch of government,
translation.ko: 현재 정부의 첫 번째 기관인 의회가

translation.en: is, right now, not functioning.
But I can think back to 1993.
The year that President Clinton nominated me for a vacancy on the Supreme Court.
translation.ko: 클린턴 대통령이 저를 대법관의 공석에 지명한 해죠

translation.en: I had spent ten years of my life litigating gender discrimination cases,
translation.ko: 전 10년 동안 성차별 관련 사건을 중재했어요

translation.en: I was one of four general counsel to the American Civil Liberties Union,
translation.ko: 게다가 미국 시민 자유 연맹의 법률 자문 네 명 중 하나였죠

translation.en: and yet the vote to confirm me was 96 to 3.
That kind of rapport doesn't exist now.
But my dream is that we will get back to it.
translation.ko: 하지만 제 꿈은 그 관계를 회복하는 거예요

translation.en: One day, I think it will take strong people on…
from both parties, to say,
translation.ko: 언젠가는 양당에서 강력한 사람들이 나와서 이러는 거요 '힘을 합쳐 국가를 위해 일합시다'

translation.en: "Let's get together and work for the good of the country."
translation.ko: 이러는 거요 '힘을 합쳐 국가를 위해 일합시다'

translation.en: It was a great man once said,
that the true symbol of the United States is not the bald eagle,
it is the pendulum.
And when the pendulum swings too far in one direction, it will go back.
translation.ko: 진자는 한쪽으로 너무 치우치면 원래대로 돌아가니까요

translation.en: Some terrible things have happened in the United States,
translation.ko: 그동안 미국에서 여러 차례 끔찍한 일이 벌어졌는데

translation.en: but one can only hope that we learn.
translation.ko: 거기서 우리가 배우는 게 있길 바랄 뿐입니다

translation.en: [interviewer] Have there been moments that have especially challenged you?
Well, I'd say the biggest challenge for me…
uh, was…
ten years ago when my husband died.
He was, as I said, my biggest booster, my biggest supporter.
translation.ko: 말했듯이 남편은 저한테 가장 큰 힘이 된 지지자였어요

translation.en: He was the first boy I ever knew who cared that I had a brain.
translation.ko: 제 머리가 좋다는 걸 좋아해 준 첫 남자였고요

translation.en: He never regarded me as any kind of a threat or competition,
translation.ko: 저를 한 번도 위협이나 경쟁자로 여기지 않았고

translation.en: just the opposite.
I think he believed that because he wanted to spend the rest of his life with me,
translation.ko: 저랑 평생을 보내고 싶었기 때문에 제가 정말 특별한 사람이라고

translation.en: I had to be something really special.
Well, I feel his loss…
every day.
But I think he would be pleased…
about what I am doing.
[interviewer] What do you think has really mattered most to you
translation.ko: "변한 세상" 지금껏 살면서 가장 중요했던 게 뭐라고 생각하세요?

translation.en: during the course of your life?
translation.ko: 지금껏 살면서 가장 중요했던 게 뭐라고 생각하세요?

translation.en: That I had the opportunity
to help a movement for change.
translation.ko: "동일 직책 동일 임금" 기회가 있었다는 거요

translation.en: Change so that daughters would be cherished as much as sons.
translation.ko: 딸도 아들만큼 소중히 여길 수 있게 한 변화죠

translation.en: There should be no spaces where women can't enter,
translation.ko: 여자가 못 들어가는 장소가 있으면 안 돼요

translation.en: as there were many in my growing up years.
Those barriers are now, thank goodness, gone.
translation.ko: 그 장벽은 정말 다행스럽게도 이제 없어졌어요

translation.en: You need two things, talent and hard work to go with it.
translation.ko: 필요한 두 가지는 재능과 그에 따르는 노력이에요

translation.en: But there should not be any artificial barriers holding you back.
translation.ko: 하지만 인위적인 장애물이 발목을 잡으면 안 되죠

translation.en: Indeed, in my lifetime,
I expect to see three, four, perhaps even more women,
translation.ko: 셋, 넷, 아니 더 많은 여성이 대법관이 되는 걸

translation.en: on the high court bench.
Women not shaped from the same mold but of different complexions.
translation.ko: 같은 틀에서 자란 여성들이 아닌 다양한 피부색의 여자들을요

translation.en: We've advanced a long way, but there's still a long way to go.
translation.ko: 우린 많이 발전했지만 아직 갈 길이 멉니다

translation.en: [interviewer] Is there any advice you would give for young prospective leaders
translation.ko: 성평등이 여전히 큰 문제가 되고 있는 지역에 사는

translation.en: in those parts of the world where gender equality is still a big issue?
translation.ko: 젊고 전도유망한 지도자들한테 해 줄 충고의 말씀이 있나요?

translation.en: Uh, if you want your country
to succeed, you should put your money
translation.ko: 나라가 성공하기를 바란다면 여성한테 더 투자해야 합니다

translation.en: with the women.
That's my dream for the world.
I'm convinced we will all be better off for it,
translation.ko: 그럼 우리 모두 더 나아질 거라고 확신해요

translation.en: if women and men are true partners.
[Ginsburg in old interview] I think the-- At least the young people that I see, think of Malala--
[woman] Malala Yousafzai?
And we should all fight for our rights, for the rights of children,
translation.ko: 우리 모두 권리를 위해 싸워야 합니다 어린이들의 권리, 여성들의 권리

translation.en: for the rights of women and for the rights of every human being.
translation.ko: 어린이들의 권리, 여성들의 권리 모든 인간의 권리를 위해서요

translation.en: -[Ginsburg] The Swedish Greta-- -[woman] Greta Thunberg. Yep. [Ginsburg] Yep.
translation.ko: - 스웨덴의 그레타 툰베리도 있죠 - 그레타 툰베리, 네

translation.en: You have not seen the last of us, we can assure you that.
translation.ko: 우리를 보는 것이 이게 마지막이 아니란 거 약속해요

translation.en: [Ginsburg] The young people that I see are fired up…
…and they want our country to be what it should be.
[interviewer] If you could talk to your younger self,
translation.ko: 어린 자신과 대화할 수 있다면 어떤 조언을 해 주고 싶어요?

translation.en: what advice would you give her?
[Ginsburg] The first advice I would give to a girl just like me
translation.ko: 나 같은 여자애한테 맨 먼저 해 주고 싶은 충고는 이거예요

translation.en: would be, "Go for it."
translation.ko: 나 같은 여자애한테 맨 먼저 해 주고 싶은 충고는 이거예요 '도전해요'

translation.en: "You can make your dreams come true
if you're willing to put in the hard work."
For a boy, I would say,
"Don't miss out on the joys and the burdens of raising your children."
translation.ko: '자녀를 기르는 즐거움과 부담감을 절대 놓치지 말아요'

translation.en: And, then, something else I would say…
"Always do something outside yourself."
translation.ko: 항상 나 외의 누군가를 위해 뭔가를 하라고요

translation.en: ♪ Sisters, let's go down Let's go down, come on down ♪
[Ginsburg] You're a member of a community.
You are blessed with having certain talents.
You should use your education and your talent
to help make things a little better
for people who are not as fortunate
as you are.
[woman] To be born into a world that does not see you,
translation.ko: 당신이 태어난 세상은 당신을 보지 못했고

translation.en: that does not believe in your potential,
that does not give you a path for opportunity
or a clear path for education.
And despite this, to be able to see beyond the world you are in,
translation.ko: 하지만 그런 역경에도 당신의 세상 그 너머를 보고

translation.en: to imagine that something can be different.
translation.ko: 뭔가 다를 수 있다는 걸 상상했죠

translation.en: That is the job of a prophet.
And it is the rare prophet who not only imagines a new world,
translation.ko: 오직 극소수의 예언자만이 새로운 세상을 상상만 하지 않고

translation.en: but also makes that new world a reality in her lifetime.
translation.ko: 살면서 그 새로운 세상을 현실로 만듭니다

translation.en: This was the brilliance and vision of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg.
translation.ko: 이게 루스 베이더 긴즈버그의 명석함과 비전이었습니다

translation.en: This was Justice Ginsburg's life's work.
To insist that the Constitution deliver on its promise.
translation.ko: 헌법이 약속을 지키도록 힘을 쏟으셨죠 "추도사 로런 홀츠블랫, 랍비"

translation.en: That "we the people" would include all the people.
She carried out that work in every chapter of her life.
translation.ko: 그녀는 삶의 모든 장에서 그 일을 수행했습니다

translation.en: As an advocate arguing six times before this court
for equal treatment for women and men.
As a judge on the DC circuit, and as a justice on this court.
translation.ko: 워싱턴 DC 순회 판사와 이 법정의 대법관으로서요

translation.en: And as a path-marking role model to women and girls of all ages,
translation.ko: 모든 연령층의 여성과 소녀들한테 길을 보여준 롤 모델이었죠 "여성들이 속한 곳"

translation.en: who now know that no office is out of reach for their dreams.
translation.ko: 이제 그들은 꿈을 이루기 위해 못 오를 곳이 없다는 걸 압니다

translation.en: Nothing could stop Justice Ginsburg's unflagging devotion to this project.
translation.ko: 이 일을 위한 긴즈버그 대법관의 헌신은 무엇도 막을 수 없었습니다

translation.en: Not even cancer.
Justice Ginsburg,
from generation to generation,
we promise to carry forward your legacy.
translation.ko: "그녀의 소원을 기리며" 당신의 유산을 계승할 것을 약속합니다
